intro: Melochia bissei, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It has palmately lobed leaves and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Melochia bissei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
